Dear Ms. McBride:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
12/16/24. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan is
required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include
the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective
action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan
(1) The social service worker shall complete,
sign, and date an initial treatment plan for each
resident within 30 calendar days of admission.
One of one treatment plans was completed outside of the required time frame.
The treatment plan was completed 42 days after admission.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Training logs: The agency was reminded to ensure that training logs show a
date for each individual training throughout the year.
• Performance Evaluations: If staff is on an extended leave of absence when a
performance evaluation is due, the agency should document in the HR file the
reason for the delayed evaluation, then complete the evaluation when the
employee returns.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted two acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
• Interim evaluation dated 12/7/23; CAP approved 12/13/24. The agency
had one citation regarding immunizations. The CAP was completed,
and no additional concerns were found.
• Special Investigation 2024SIC0001595, dated 10/3/24; CAP approved
10/31/24. The agency was cited regarding a staff member that failed to
follow their program statement. The agency continues to implement this
CAP. Monitoring of this CAP is expected to conclude in April 2025.
There are no additional concerns at this time.
Financial Overview
The financial assessment for 2024 is in progress. A draft copy was reviewed, in
addition to the 2024/2025 budgets. No concerns were noted.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed and discussed on-site. The
assessment did not indicate any barriers to compliance over the past year.
Overall, the Chief Administrator indicated the agency was able to implement their
CAP from the 2023 Interim review and maintain compliance throughout the year.
The agency did not have any seclusions, restraints, or unplanned discharges.

Staff and Youth Interviews
One staff and one youth were interviewed on-site. The youth was new to the
program and did not have any concerns to report. The staff indicated that
everything was going well. Staff felt supported by the agency and did not express
any needs.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The facility was clean, organized and in good repair. Youth bedrooms had
appropriate seasonal bedding and adequate storage space for personal
belongings. The kitchen was well stocked with food and had locked storage for
medications. No concerns were noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A Corrective Action Plan is required.
